isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLES: SPICER J400-S, W460-S - ASSEMBLE - INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: Install rear side gear into rear differential case half ( Figure 81).

note.para: There is no shoulder on rear side gear and no thrust washers are required behind this side gear.

step1.para: Install cross shaft, pinions and thrust washers into differential case half ( Figure 82).

figure.caption: Figure 81. Install Cross Shaft, Pinions and Thrust Washers into Differential Case Half

step1.para: Place front side gear onto pinions and place thrust washers (2 metal surrounding 1 fiber) onto front side gear ( Figure 83).

figure.caption: Figure 82. Place Thrust Washers onto Front Side Gear

step1.para: Align match marks on case halves and assemble. If case halves were not match marked, there are three holes machined in one quadrant that can be aligned for proper assembly. Install differential case bolts and tighten to 75 to 90 ft-lbs. (102 to 122 Nm) ( Figure 84).

figure.caption: Figure 83. Align Match Marks on Case Halves and Assemble

step1.para: Press bearing cone onto input shaft of inter-axle differential. Install bearing cup into cover housing without shims ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 84. Press Bearing Cone onto Input Shaft of Inter-Axle Differential

step1.para: Install inter-axle differential into intermediate case (without the ball bearing installed at this time) and place inter-axle cover into position ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Place Inter-Axle Cover into Position

step1.para: Secure cover in place with four bolts. Bolts do not have to be tightened, but should be tight enough to prevent movement.

Position a dial indicator on input shaft of inter-axle differential. Use a lever arm and pry differential up to measure end play. Record this dimension. Remove inter-axle cover and inter-axle differential. Remove bearing cup from cover ( Figure 87).

End play for the inter-axle differential is .001 to .005 inch. From the dimension recorded, subtract .001 to .005 for correct shim required. Install proper shim and bearing cup into inter-axle cover ( Figure 88).

figure.caption: Figure 87. Install Proper Shim and Bearing Cup into Inter-Axle Cover

step1.para: Press ball bearing onto rear of case of inter-axle differential ( Figure 89).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Press Ball Bearing onto Rear of Inter-Axle Differential Case

step1.para: Assemble spiral snap ring onto differential case. Be sure snap ring is completely seated into groove ( Figure 90).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Assemble Spiral Snap Ring onto Differential Case

step1.para: Install input seal into inter-axle cover. Apply light coat of lubricant onto seal prior to installation. Assemble end yoke onto input shaft of inter-axle differential. Mount end yoke in vise ( Figure 91).

figure.caption: Figure 90. Install Input Seal into Inter-Axle Cover and Assemble End Yoke onto Input Shaft of Inter-Axle Differential

step1.para: Clean and dry threads. Coat threads with Loctite #680 adhesive compound, or its equivalent. Tighten new prevailing torque nut to 500 to 600 ft-lbs. (678 to 813 Nm) ( Figure 92).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Tighten New Prevailing Torque Nut
